TextBody:
Hi Sam,

Please find below the answers to you questions and the script:

1. The script mentioned in the documentation link is the options.sh script. I will attach it to this email. Please also find below instructions on how to configure the script with the information needed:

After you download the client and extract it, please edit options.sh to remove # from the lines below.

Also replace "set.this.to.the.endpointprotector.server.com" with your EPP server IP

#EPPCLIENT_WS_SERVER=set.this.to.the.endpointprotector.server.com
#export EPPCLIENT_WS_SERVER

#EPPCLIENT_WS_PORT=443
#export EPPCLIENT_WS_PORT

#EPPCLIENT_DEPARTMENT_CODE=defdep
#export EPPCLIENT_DEPARTMENT_CODE

Save the changed file.
Install the EPP client using the install.sh file.

2. If you are referring to the "set_epp_client_server.sh" this is not needed. The options.sh script is needed because it contains the IP/DNS/FQDN to which the EPP clients will connect to.

Please let me know if there is any other information that we can provide.

Best Regards,
Flaviu Moldovan | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
